To: Marin County EMS Constituents
Grant Colfax, MD
From: Dustin Ballard, MD; Medical Director
DIRECTOR
Marin County EMS Agency
Emergency Medical Services Date: December 20, 2017
1600 Los Gamos Drive
Suite 220 Re: Interim Policy Memo 2017-4: Medication Shortages
San Rafael, CA 94903
415 473 6871 T
Over the last year there have been several instances of our EMS providers facing
415 473 3747 F
medication shortages. This has become a national challenge that does not appear
415 473 3344 TTY
to be improving and we expect additional future shortages.
www.marinEMS.org
In order to provide a consistent process in dealing with this ongoing issue, the EMS
Agency will use the following procedure:
• The provider experiencing the medication shortage will notify the EMS
Agency in writing.
• The notification should include the name of the medication, the expiration
dates, the expected dates for restock to arrive and proposed alternatives
(action plan) to be used during the shortage period. We recommend the
action plan consider all options and be based on historical medication
utilization by the provider. Consideration should be given to: adjusting par
levels, substitution, or extension of expiration dates (if FDA approved).
• The EMS Agency will review each request and will either approve the action
plan or propose alternatives. Each request will be reviewed on a case-by-
case basis; and a separate request will be required for each medication if
multiple medications are on back order at the same time.
